summary.p: This type is only available in .NET. Its C++ equivalent is float4.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of Vector4.
member.param: Value to initialize each component to.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector4.Length
member.summary: Calculates the length, or Euclidean distance, of the vector.

member.summary: Calculates the length, or Euclidean distance, of the vector squared.

member.summary: Returns a vector that contains the lowest value from each matching pair of components.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector4.Max(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Returns a vector that contains the highest value from each matching pair of components.

member.summary: Restricts a value to be within a specified range.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector4.op_Equality(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Determines whether two instances of Vector4 are equal.
member.remarks: Uses an exact floating point equality comparison, which is not advised if the values being compared are the result of computations which could have introduced floating point precision errors. In such cases, comparing DistanceSquared against a very small tolerance threshold may be a better approach.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector4.op_Inequality(System.Numerics.Vector4,System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Determines whether two instances of Vector4 are not equal.
member.remarks: Uses an exact floating point equality comparison, which is not advised if the values being compared are the result of computations which could have introduced floating point precision errors. In such cases, comparing DistanceSquared against a very small tolerance threshold may be a better approach.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector4.Equals(System.Numerics.Vector4)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified Vector4 is equal to the Vector4.
member.remarks: Uses an exact floating point equality comparison, which is not advised if the values being compared are the result of computations which could have introduced floating point precision errors. In such cases, comparing DistanceSquared against a very small tolerance threshold may be a better approach.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector4.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified Object is equal to the Vector4.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector4.ToString
member.summary: Returns a String that represents the current Vector4.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector4.GetHashCode
member.summary: Gets the hash code for this object.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector4.op_Implicit(System.Numerics.Vector4)~Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Vector4
member.summary: Converts a System.Numerics.Vector4 to a Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Vector4.
member.remarks: This allows application code to use the rich System.Numerics math types, then pass these objects directly to WinRT APIs that use the WinRT structs from Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.

member.name: M:System.Numerics.Vector4.op_Implicit(Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Vector4)~System.Numerics.Vector4
member.summary: Converts a Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Vector4 to a System.Numerics.Vector4.
member.remarks: This allows application code to use the rich System.Numerics math types, and assign to these objects directly from the return values of WinRT APIs that use the WinRT structs from Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.

member.name: P:System.Numerics.Vector4.Zero
member.summary: Returns a Vector4 with all of its components set to zero.

member.name: P:System.Numerics.Vector4.One
member.summary: Returns a Vector4 with all of its components set to one.

member.name: P:System.Numerics.Vector4.UnitX
member.summary: Returns the Vector4 (1, 0, 0, 0).

member.name: P:System.Numerics.Vector4.UnitY
member.summary: Returns the Vector4 (0, 1, 0, 0).

member.name: P:System.Numerics.Vector4.UnitZ
member.summary: Returns the Vector4 (0, 0, 1, 0).

member.name: P:System.Numerics.Vector4.UnitW
member.summary: Returns the Vector4 (0, 0, 0, 1).
